intro: Urophyllum creaghii, commonly known as the Creagh's uruphylum, is a rare and unique plant native to the Western Cape region of South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, umbrella-like inflorescence. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Urophyllum creaghii is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
